items.title: Slow loading components
items.body:
Hi,

I'm facing a "problem" on refreshing HA. I'm not sure if this is normal or not. But I think this is not normal because is very annoying and I wan't to confirm if I miss something or is normal do that. I'm on version 0.108.3 and HACS 0.24.0, setted up on yaml:
```
hacs:
  token: xxxxxxxx
  sidepanel_title: HACS
  sidepanel_icon: "mdi:alpha-c-box"
```
and added the following to resources:
```
# https://github.com/thomasloven/lovelace-card-mod
- url: /hacsfiles/lovelace-card-mod/card-mod.js
  type: module
# https://github.com/cbulock/lovelace-battery-entity
- url: /hacsfiles/lovelace-battery-entity/battery-entity.js
  type: module
# https://github.com/custom-cards/button-card
- url: /hacsfiles/button-card/button-card.js
  type: module
```
I've tried 3 different plugins: "Battery Entity Card", "button-card" and "card-mod".
What happen is if I apply any custom component, when I refresh page, it loads the page without the components and then after millisecons, loads the component, and it shows like a "flick". Without applying custom components, it dont do that. Please check the gifs bellow:
![recording1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17064445/79585996-78663480-80c8-11ea-8dc3-213df511401b.gif)
![recording2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17064445/79586003-7a2ff800-80c8-11ea-8d54-140da5c2f6e9.gif)

Now, this is how an enitty works without custom cards, see the difference:
![Recording-_5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17064445/79586442-0510f280-80c9-11ea-8afa-6b3dc9400120.gif)

Also my Header make a flicks, and I have the original one... What is making this happen? or is that normal? thank's

items.title: Lists sometimes displayed wrong when coming from HA config
items.body:
Hi,
sometimes when I open HACS, the lists are weirdly misaligned. If I reload the page directly on HACS, everything is fine again:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30938717/78470055-9e81f100-7726-11ea-9d64-497b3f8268a3.png)

After reload:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30938717/78470061-ae013a00-7726-11ea-8aeb-1aec606f7ad8.png)

I don't know if this is the only cause (I just didn't find any other reproducible cause so far), but I noticed that this happen all the time, wenn I reload HA in the config (URL: `/config/dashboard`) and then switch to HACS any time later.

By the way: I have this problem since the beginning of the new HACS UI, if I remember correctly - I just was to busy/lazy (sorry) to find out what the cause might be and post an issue.

There are no errors in the console and I'm always on an up to date version of HA, HACS, Edge Chromium and Win 10.

I hope you can help me! Please tell me if you need more information.
Thank you very much!

items.title: Cannot uninstall plugin from archived repository (throws JS error)
items.body:
(originally filed as https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues/1024)
### Version of HACS: 0.23.2
Home Assistant 0.107.7

## Describe the bug
When I try to uninstall a plugin from an archived repository (in my case, [Lovelace Markdown Mod](https://github.com/thomasloven/lovelace-markdown-mod)) a spinner appears and never goes away as long as I stay on the page. The plugin is not uninstalled. There is a JS error thrown in the console that appears to indicate that the uninstall command never makes it to the HACS backend.

Note that the "An error occurred while processing" message in the below screenshot shows up as soon as I open the HACS page for Lovelace Markdown Mod (not when I confirm the uninstall).

items.title: Use mdc-theme-primary for buttons
items.body:
## Version of HACS
0.21.6

## Describe the bug
Buttons in dialoges (e.g. for restarting home assistant after HACS update) should use the same styling as home assistant buttons (e.g. for restarting from server settings).

Currently HACS uses primary-color as button background and primary-text-color as font color. This results in unreadable buttons in some themes (e.g. my clear-theme-dark):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12081369/75613103-22dec400-5b2a-11ea-98f1-868d1d5f2b7f.png)

The home assistant default for these buttons is a transparent background and mdc-theme-primary as font color.

items.title: Add Github issue templates to hacs/frontend
Authors list only has seperating comma for last member
items.body:
In the image below, for a given repo (custom repo, not yet community), there is a missing seperator between the first two authors. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1027111/74111934-b6ab1900-4b98-11ea-8cc6-7ccd82fb1168.png)

I think the issue is here, with the re-use of the `seperatorElement`. It can probably only be used once, and thus by "reusing" it, it's moved from its original placement. Creating a new seperator for each author would probably resolve this.

https://github.com/hacs/frontend/blob/e1375ab6b30beda3bf122e1bc3ca035dd5e70087/src/misc/RepositoryAuthors.ts#L22-L32

Extra, the DOM for the authors tag:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1027111/74111953-ec500200-4b98-11ea-8e31-55adbc23fd6e.png)

items.title: Add ability to configure Tabs after installation.
items.body:
I never checked 'python scripts' as a tab when installing.  I'd like to add that tab and it's items via the configuration menu.

I envision the options in the integration page containing checkboxes for each tab.  Checked = tab is visible w/ contained items.

items.title: Superextranouflous error message thrown adding first Python Script
items.body:
## Version of HACS

Integration version: | 0.20.7
Frontend version: | 20200104192235
Repositories: | 376

## Describe the bug
- I had a pre-existing folder `/config/python_scripts` that contained a single `.py` that was installed manually
- Used `HACS >> Python Scripts` and installed my first Python script via `HACS`; `Date Countdown v3.0`.
- `HACS` threw a warning, I can't bring it back, but it essentially stated that the folder `python_scripts` already existed and that it would be *overwritten*.
- I took a backup of the folder and proceeded with `OK` in `HACS`.
- Folder was not overwritten, but appended perfectly so that the end result was two `.py` files living happily, side by side.
- Conclusion: _one two maney erors msgs._ 

## Debug log

```text

Nothing to debug.

```

items.title: listicon and saveicon should not use primary-color
items.body:
I'm not entirely sure if this is a HACS issue, polymer, or homeassistant, but so far only stumbled on `saveicon` and `listicon` elements in HACS, so submitting an issue here. (Also; already tried at [ha-polymer](https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant-polymer/issues/4394).)

HACS uses elements `saveicon` and `listicon` and they are coloured via `primary-color`. I'd like to suggest they should not, but rather by `paper-item-icon` or some such? Text-color (primary or secondary) would also be an option, as would accent-color -- but not primary. In a minimalistic theme, it leads to the icons in effect being invisible.

items.title: Country filter not working as expected
items.body:
I just updated HACS from 0.19 to 0.20.2, and I previously had enabled a country filter.
After the update, the tabs (integration, plugin, app daemon...) did not display any module. After changing the configuration to remove the country filter, I could see the modules again.
The behavior of this filter has changed in release 0.20: I believe it was used to hide irrelevant modules for the given country, now it only shows modules for the  country set in filter.

items.title: Reloading data seems to take forever
items.body: When I click the Reload Data button in the settings tab the thing begins to spin and never finishes. I have to restart HA to get it to stop.

items.title: Needs manual intervention to remove uninstalled plugin
items.body:
<!-- Learn how to submit an issue here https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues -->
<!-- Before you open a new issue, search through the existing issues to see if others have had the same problem.

Issues not containing the minimum requirements will be closed:

- Issues without a description (using the header is not good enough) will be closed.
- Issues without debug logging will be closed.

-->

## Version of HACS
0.19.0

<!-- If you are not using the newest version, download and try that before opening an issue
If you are unsure about the version check the "SETTINGS" tab.
-->


## Describe the bug
I installed a couple of plugins (card-tools and secondaryinfo entity row) which I have since uninstalled. Ever since uninstalling, I get errors in homeassistant.log stating that hacs is trying to serve up those plugins, but that they don't exist. These errors also seem to force the frontend to reload which is rather annoying.

I have tried re-installing, and then uninstalling the components a second time, and the errors persist.


## Debug log

<!-- To enable debug logs check this https://www.home-assistant.io/components/logger/ -->

```homeassistant.log

items.title: Help button link in HA goes to blank page
items.body:
When clicking on the orange help icon in Home Assistant the link opens a blank page with HACS headers.

items.title: Display Github stars as a measure of popularity
items.body:
There is a massive amount of plugins and integrations (and more) in the community store.

Some of them might just be gimmicks and some are super useful packages that a lot of people use.

Right now there is no way of finding out which repos are the popular and frequently used ones, and which ones aren't.

I think it would be great if the plugins would display the amount of Github stars ⭐️ inside the overview of installable repos as a measure of popularity.

An alternative is to display the number of installs, but that would require keeping track of this in a database.

items.title: Feature request: Sorting content by number of downloads
items.body:
# Describe the solution you'd like
Since the content of the store grows every day it is not really usable to browse the content to see if there is anything you might find useful. A sorting function to sort the contents for number of downloads would be really nice in order to find the popular projects. Listing downloads for latest release should be a good measurement of how popular it is, even though the numbers will go down for a while after a new release. There are probably more measurement that are relevant but I think this is a good start.

# Describe alternatives you've considered
At the moment there is not really a good alternative. I try to check into the forums for popular project sometimes but that does not provide a full picture.

# Additional context
download_count is accessible through the
GitHub API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/releases/
A specific release can be fetched by 
GET /repos/:owner/:repo/releases/:release_id

items.title: actionlink uses primary-color instead of primary-*text*-color
items.body: ## Version of HACS 0.16.3 ## Describe the bug A minimalistic theme makes some HACS-buttons invisible. (Yes, it sounds like it's a theming error. Might be. Let me explain further.) So I might be wrong, but the `actionlink` element in `frontend/elements/hacs.css` uses `var(--primary-color)`. Shouldn't it be `var(--primary-text-color)`? Though I'm new to theming, this is the only place so far where I've seen primary-color used for text.

items.title: Feature Request: Landing page is available updates, otherwise it shows installed
items.body:
I find that even (moreso?) with the experimental UI, I'm doing a lot of scrolling to check what needs to be updated.  With the grid view this is a little easier, but still seems inefficient.

What would be awesome is that if anything that HACS is tracking is in need of an update, instead INSTALLED being the landing page, the would be another tab that appears only when there are updates and provides a filtered list of just the things that require an update.  The existing INSTALLED tab as well as all the others would still be there, this new tab would simply appear as the first tab.

(EDIT: It should also comply with the hiding feature!  Same thing for the sensor alternative below.)

I guess an alternative to this would be a sensor that didn't just show the count, but provided a list of the names, installed versions and version available (even better, with the version available hyperlinking to the changelog).  Then you could quickly check the sensor in a Lovelace card.

I feel like I miss this kind of ability from the old Custom Updater days.  But I *do* love HACS; what it's become and what it promises for the future!  Just a suggestion.

items.title: create a "bookmarked" flag
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]

When there is a new component added it gets a "new" flag and that's good since it allows you to easily find new items. 

The problem is that sometimes the summary isn't good enough to know if you want to install it so you have to click the component to get more info. Which removes the new flag.

So now I'm in the component description area and I decide I like it but I don't necessarily want to install it right now but come back to it later. But there's no way to mark it for later.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

provide a check box or button to add a "bookmarked" flag to the component listing in the "store" section.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
